docs.text: Introduction Hi Everyone! I'm Hamzah, an AI/ML engineer and an adjunct professor of Statistics. On this page, you will find a collection of notes spanning topics from probability and statistics to machine learning. Whether you’re just starting out or looking to deepen your understanding, there’s something here for everyone!
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Hi Everyone! I'm Hamzah, an AI/ML engineer and an adjunct professor of Statistics. docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Statistical Inference Statistical Inference is the process of drawing general conclusions about the population using insights gained from a sample. The main question that we'd want to answer is exactly how reliable is the information that we gain from a sample? Before we delve into answering the above question, let's go over a few defintions. Parameter vs Statistic parameter: a number that summarizes entire population data. statistic: a number that summarizes sample data. Parameter Statistic Mean $\mu$ \bar{x} Variance $\sigma^{2}$ $s^{2}$ Standard Deviation $\sigma$ $s$
